page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: West Linton primary school is a state school for children from 5-12 years of age. We do not pay fees. It is a semi rural school 16 miles from Edinburgh. The roll is about 160 and we have 7 teachers including the headmaster. We also have specialist teachers for art, music,sewing and physical education. The building is large and has been modernised a few years ago. We have a large gymnasium which is sometimes used for village activities.eg,dances. We have a school kitchen that cooks for us and for the old people from the the village who are supplid with lunches. Many children do not take school lunches but bring their own packed lunches with them. Transport is provided for children who live in outlying districts. When we leave this school we go to Peebles High School, 14 miles away.
